00042 class MAIN_Logger

00049         const ERROR    = 256;
00050 
00055         const WARNING  = 512;
00056 
00061         const NOTICE   = 1024;
00062 
00067         const INFO     = -1;
00068 
00073         const DEBUG    = -2;
00074 
00079         const USER     = -3;
00080 
00085         private $log = array();
00086 
00097         public function log($level, $callback, $message) {
00098                 // First get a string with the level.
00099                 switch($level) {
00100                         case self::ERROR:
00101                                 $level = 'ERROR';
00102                                 break;
00103                         case self::WARNING:
00104                                 $level = 'WARNING';
00105                                 break;
00106                         case self::NOTICE:
00107                                 $level = 'NOTICE';
00108                                 break;
00109                         case self::INFO:
00110                                 $level = 'INFO';
00111                                 break;
00112                         case self::DEBUG:
00113                                 $level = 'DEBUG';
00114                                 break;
00115                         case self::USER:
00116                                 $level = 'USER ERROR';
00117                                 break;
00118                         default:
00119                                 return new MAIN_Error(MAIN_Error::ERROR, 'MAIN_Logger::log', "Invalid level $level.");
00120                 }
00121 
00122                 // Retrieve any other variables necessary.
00123                 $time = gmdate('c');
00124                 $pid  = getmypid();
00125                 $id   = ID;
00126 
00127                 // Create log line and append.
00128                 $this->log[] = "$time ($pid - $id) : $level [$callback] - $message";
00129                 return true;
00130         }
00131 
00140         public function export($filename) {
00141                 clearstatcache();
00142                 // Check the filename and return if already exists AND
00143                 // is not a normal file.
00144                 $filename = realpath($filename);
00145                 if(!file_exists($filename) || !is_file($filename)) {
00146                         return new MAIN_Error(MAIN_Error::ERROR, 'MAIN_Logger::export', 'Log file is not a valid file.', $this);
00147                 } $file = fopen($filename, 'a');
00148 
00149                 // Check if the file failed to open,
00150                 // then check if it is writable.
00151                 if($file === false) {
00152                         return new MAIN_Error(MAIN_Error::ERROR, 'MAIN_Logger::export', 'Log file failed to open.', $this);
00153                 } elseif(!is_writable($filename)) {
00154                         fclose($file);
00155                         return new MAIN_Error(MAIN_Error::ERROR, 'MAIN_Logger::export', 'Log file is not writeable.', $this);
00156                 }
00157 
00158                 // Append the log to the file and close.
00159                 $lines  = implode("\n\n", $this->log) . "\n";
00160                 $retval = fwrite($file, $lines);
00161                 fclose($file);
00162 
00163                 // Blank the internal log on success.
00164                 if($retval == strlen($lines)) {
00165                         $this->log = array();
00166                         return $retval;
00167                 } else {
00168                         return new MAIN_Error(MAIN_Error::ERROR, 'MAIN_Logger::export', 'Writing to log file failed.', $this);
00169                 }
00170         }
00171 }
